intro: Galium duthiei var. glabriusculum, commonly known as the smooth woodypod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
